title: Clorox Wins 2023 EPA Award for Advancing Green Chemistry - PR Newswire
summary: The Clorox Company has been recognized by the EPA for its development of Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner, which is made with a plant-based active ingredient. The Clorox EcoClean™ line of products is part of the company's commitment to sustainability and reducing the use of hazardous substances.
green_innovation: TRUE. Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner is a green innovation because it reduces the generation and use of hazardous substances.
business_innovation: TRUE. Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner is a business innovation because it is a new product that is significantly different from the company's previous products.
green_product: TRUE. Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner is a green product because it is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a green process.
likely_naics_codes: ['325611 - Soap and Other Detergent Manufacturing', '325612 - Polish and Other Sanitation Good Manufacturing', '325991 - Custom Compounding of Purchased Resins', '325199 - All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing']
greenwashing: FALSE. Clorox EcoClean™ Disinfecting Cleaner is not an example of greenwashing because it does meet the criteria to be a green product.

title: Innovations from Cosmetic 360's 2023 edition - BW Confidential
summary: Cosmetic 360, a trade show dedicated to innovation in the beauty industry, featured a range of green innovations, including eco-conceived brands, decarbonization efforts, and green chemistry. The show also saw the launch of a new office in Shanghai by Cosmetic Valley to support companies' export business and boost France's attractiveness. Several companies showcased their latest innovations, including Perfect Corp's AI skin diagnosis tool, Anjac Health & Beauty's airflow technology for creating whipped textures, and Avery Dennison's digital ID solution for connected products.
green_innovation: TRUE, the innovations presented at Cosmetic 360 are designed to reduce negative environmental externalities of human activity by individuals or organizations, such as decarbonization, reducing or replacing harmful substances, reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy, nature and wildlife conservation, or the protection of biological systems.
business_innovation: TRUE, the innovations presented at Cosmetic 360 are new or improved products or business processes (or combination thereof) that differ significantly from the firm's previous products or business processes and that have been introduced on the market or brought into use by the firm.
green_product: TRUE, the innovations presented at Cosmetic 360 are goods or services that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, the innovations presented at Cosmetic 360 are methods or techniques in manufacturing, production, or any other operational activity that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.

greenwashing: FALSE, the article does not provide any evidence of greenwashing.

title: Coffee biorefinery opened in Denmark to upcycle coffee grounds - FoodNavigator.com
summary: Kaffe Bueno opened a new €2.5 million biorefinery in Denmark to upcycle coffee grounds into food and cosmetics ingredients. The biorefinery prevents emissions that would have come from the coffee grounds had they been disposed of, such as methane, which is 25 times more potent than CO2. The company plans to expand to other locations in the future.
green_innovation: TRUE, the biorefinery contributes to the environmental sustainability goal of reducing waste and emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE, the biorefinery is a new and improved business process that differs significantly from the company's previous processes and has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: TRUE, the biorefinery's products are made from upcycled coffee grounds, which reduces waste and emissions.
green_process: TRUE, the biorefinery's process uses green chemistry and biotechnology to transform coffee grounds into different inputs/ingredients for personal care, human and animal nutrition, and agriculture, which reduces emissions.
likely_naics_codes: ['311999: All Other Food Manufacturing', '325612: Cosmetic and Perfume Manufacturing', '562111: Solid Waste Collection', '562112: Hazardous Waste Collection']

title: CPHI Barcelona 2023 - Event preview - European Pharmaceutical Review
summary: CPHI Barcelona 2023, a global pharma event, will take place in October 2023. It will focus on topics such as sustainability, next-gen biomanufacturing, formulation, and future therapies. The event will feature a dedicated space for start-ups to showcase their innovations.

title: Top pharma companies 2023: A satisfactory year - PharmaLive
summary: Pfizer acquired Seagen in a $43 billion deal to accelerate oncology breakthroughs and bring new solutions to patients by combining the power of Seagen's antibody-drug conjugate technology with the scale and strength of Pfizer's capabilities and expertise.  Takeda acquired Nimbus Lakshmi to gain access to TAK-279, a potential best-in-class treatment for psoriasis and other immune-mediated diseases.  In response to the Inflation Reduction Act, several pharmaceutical companies have filed lawsuits to block the drug price negotiations, arguing that the provisions violate the Constitution's separation of power and due process clauses.
green_innovation: TRUE. The acquisition of Seagen by Pfizer is a green innovation because it combines the power of Seagen's antibody-drug conjugate technology with the scale and strength of Pfizer's capabilities and expertise to accelerate oncology breakthroughs and bring new solutions to patients.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article does not describe any new or improved business processes or functions.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not describe any products that reduce negative environmental externalities of human activity.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe any processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.

greenwashing: The article does not describe any examples of greenwashing.
